rev.comment: /* Guest stars */ no rationale for use per [[WP:NFCC]] #10c, plus image is available at main article anyway
rev.diff:
Line 54: Line 54:
===Guest stars===
===Guest stars===
â
[[Image:Michael Cutter - L&O.png|thumb|right|[[Linus Roache]] reprises his role of [[Mike Cutter|EADA Michael Cutter]] from [[Law & Order]].]]
 
[[Linus Roache]] reprises his role of [[Mike Cutter|EADA Michael Cutter]] from the [[Law & Order|original ''Law & Order'' series]] in the season premiere episode. Cutter has been promoted at the DA's office to Bureau Chief EADA in which he oversees the ADAs assigned to the Special Victims Unit. Show runner [[Warren Leight]] stated, "If Cutter was a bit of a hot head in the past, the passage of time and some added responsibility in his new job has made him more mature, and perhaps a bit more jaded." Roache had to say, "I learned a lot from my time on ''Law & Order'' and it's going to be interesting to experiment with Cutter's development in this new context â I think Special Victims is going to be an area where Cutter's passion for justice can really come forth."<ref name="CutterSVU">{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Law & Order Alum Linus Roache to Reprise Role on SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Linus-Roache-1036212.aspx|accessdate=August 8, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 8, 2011}}</ref> [[Franco Nero]] guest starred in the season premiere episode as an Italian dignitary accused of rape, evoking the [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn sexual assault case|Dominique Strauss-Kahn arrest]].<ref name="StraussKahnNero">{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Exclusive: International Film Star Takes on Dominique Strauss-Kahn for Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-DSK-Nero-1036309.aspx|accessdate=August 11, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 11, 2011}}</ref> [[imdbname:0308150|Kathleen Garrett]] plays the Italian dignitary's "stand-by-your-man" wife, [[Ron Rifkin]] played his savvy defense lawyer - similar to Strauss-Kahn's real-life lawyer, [[Benjamin Brafman]].<ref>{{cite news|last= |first=ANDY CAMPBELL and EMILY SMITH|title="Law & Order" shooting Dominique Strauss-Kahn related episode on East 58th Street|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/dsk_on_role_8KwTyPuFr3i8i0ocYNDDVJ|accessdate=August 17, 2011|newspaper=''[[New York Post]]''|date=August 17, 2011}}</ref> [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] stars [[Carmelo Anthony]] ([[New York Knicks]]) and [[Chris Bosh]] ([[Miami Heat]]) play themselves in cameo guest appearances in the episode titled, "[[#ep2|Personal Fouls]]". [[Mehcad Brooks]] plays Prince Miller, a fictional basketball superstar who was once one of the coach's prodigies. Rapper/actor [[Heavy D]] plays Miller's cousin and business manager, Supreme. Anthony and Bosh appeared in the opening scene and episode climax.<ref name="AnthonyBoshBrooks">{{cite news|title=NBA Stars Carmelo Anthony and Chris Bosh to Make Guest Appearances on Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/08/22/nba-stars-carmelo-anthony-and-chris-bosh-to-make-guest-appearances-on-law-order-svu/index.php|newspaper=''[[NBC]]''|accessdate=August 22, 2011|date=August 22, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Norman|first=Randy|title=Mehcad Brooks: Good to Be Bad|url=http://www.bet.com/news/celebrities/2011/08/10/mehcad-brooks-good-to-be-bad.html|accessdate=August 10, 2011|newspaper=''[[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]''|date=August 10, 2011}}</ref>
[[Linus Roache]] reprises his role of [[Mike Cutter|EADA Michael Cutter]] from the [[Law & Order|original ''Law & Order'' series]] in the season premiere episode. Cutter has been promoted at the DA's office to Bureau Chief EADA in which he oversees the ADAs assigned to the Special Victims Unit. Show runner [[Warren Leight]] stated, "If Cutter was a bit of a hot head in the past, the passage of time and some added responsibility in his new job has made him more mature, and perhaps a bit more jaded." Roache had to say, "I learned a lot from my time on ''Law & Order'' and it's going to be interesting to experiment with Cutter's development in this new context â I think Special Victims is going to be an area where Cutter's passion for justice can really come forth."<ref name="CutterSVU">{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Law & Order Alum Linus Roache to Reprise Role on SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-Linus-Roache-1036212.aspx|accessdate=August 8, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 8, 2011}}</ref> [[Franco Nero]] guest starred in the season premiere episode as an Italian dignitary accused of rape, evoking the [[Dominique Strauss-Kahn sexual assault case|Dominique Strauss-Kahn arrest]].<ref name="StraussKahnNero">{{cite news|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|title=Exclusive: International Film Star Takes on Dominique Strauss-Kahn for Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/SVU-DSK-Nero-1036309.aspx|accessdate=August 11, 2011|newspaper=''[[TV Guide]]''|date=August 11, 2011}}</ref> [[imdbname:0308150|Kathleen Garrett]] plays the Italian dignitary's "stand-by-your-man" wife, [[Ron Rifkin]] played his savvy defense lawyer - similar to Strauss-Kahn's real-life lawyer, [[Benjamin Brafman]].<ref>{{cite news|last= |first=ANDY CAMPBELL and EMILY SMITH|title="Law & Order" shooting Dominique Strauss-Kahn related episode on East 58th Street|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/dsk_on_role_8KwTyPuFr3i8i0ocYNDDVJ|accessdate=August 17, 2011|newspaper=''[[New York Post]]''|date=August 17, 2011}}</ref> [[National Basketball Association|NBA]] stars [[Carmelo Anthony]] ([[New York Knicks]]) and [[Chris Bosh]] ([[Miami Heat]]) play themselves in cameo guest appearances in the episode titled, "[[#ep2|Personal Fouls]]". [[Mehcad Brooks]] plays Prince Miller, a fictional basketball superstar who was once one of the coach's prodigies. Rapper/actor [[Heavy D]] plays Miller's cousin and business manager, Supreme. Anthony and Bosh appeared in the opening scene and episode climax.<ref name="AnthonyBoshBrooks">{{cite news|title=NBA Stars Carmelo Anthony and Chris Bosh to Make Guest Appearances on Law & Order: SVU|url=http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/08/22/nba-stars-carmelo-anthony-and-chris-bosh-to-make-guest-appearances-on-law-order-svu/index.php|newspaper=''[[NBC]]''|accessdate=August 22, 2011|date=August 22, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Norman|first=Randy|title=Mehcad Brooks: Good to Be Bad|url=http://www.bet.com/news/celebrities/2011/08/10/mehcad-brooks-good-to-be-bad.html|accessdate=August 10, 2011|newspaper=''[[Black Entertainment Television|BET]]''|date=August 10, 2011}}</ref>
